availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert C. Blakey (Simpson Co. and Warren Co. KY, saddler and tanner)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, saddler and tanner. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Starke Blakey in Warren County, Kentucky, on December 24, 1833. Married to Frances Ann Flurry Blakey in Warren County on January 7, 1839. Father of Anne E. Blakey, Margaret C. Blakey, Carissa P. Blakey, and James H. Blakey. Married to Mary Blakey. Father of Eliza L. Blakey. Resident in Warren County in 1840. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Warren County in 1840. Saddler in Warren County in 1850. Employed D. B. Johnston and Jesse C. Beck as saddlers in Warren County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Boss tanner in Simpson County in 1860. Employed James H. Terry as a harness maker, and James McCarley and George Granger as apprentice tanners in Simpson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Simpson County in 1860. With J. C. Wilkins, operating as Wilkins & Blakey, owned one enslaved person in Simpson County in 1860. Employed one enslaved person in Simpson County in 1860.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 308B.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000164003, p. 151 (accessed via ancestry.com).
